metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
IP address spoofing when proxying using mod_remoteip and mod_rewrite Forconfigurations using proxying with mod_remoteip and certain mod_rewriterules, an attacker could spoof their IP address for logging and PHPscripts. Note this issue was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.24 but wasretrospectively allocated a low severity CVE in 2020.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.13').
